paragraph.paragraph: Traditionally in the Visual Studio .NET vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser window project references are consolidated and displayed along side the projects, in the Objects pane. EiffelEnvision projects and the ../../../eiffel_for_dotnet/index.xmlEiffel for .NET compiler work with ../../eiffelenvision_projects/structure/references/index.xmlComponent References differently and require an alternative means to display them. In order to work with Eiffel for .NET, assemblies must be "consumed" by the Eiffel for .NET compiler. When consumed, assembly types and features are formatted into Eiffel-case. The formatting/conversion process is detailed in ../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/90_assembly_formatting.xmlReferenced Assembly Type and Feature Name Conversion. In addition, ../../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/reference.xmlclass_name_prefixClass Name Prefixes may also be set for any ../../eiffelenvision_projects/structure/references/index.xmlComponent Reference in an EiffelEnvision Project. With such conversion and customization, EiffelEnvision's ../../eiffelenvision_projects/structure/references/index.xmlComponent References cannot be consolidated with other project references. ../../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/item_configuration/reference.xmlclass_name_prefixClass Name Prefixes further prevent consolidation as they are project-specific. As a result, EiffelEnvision project's in the vxurfObjectBrowserS 0 Object Browser have their own References ( ../images/assembly/hier_reference_all.ico ) section.
Expanding the References node will yield a list of assemblies.xmlAssembly Nodes, representing the ../../eiffelenvision_projects/structure/references/index.xmlComponent References in your project.

link.label: Visual Studio .NET Class View and Object Browser Icons
